lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglwcrn
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur scw pwiqswh pwiqswhw pwiqswhu isrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sachaa Paatisaahu Paatisaahaa Paatisaahu Sirandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is true emperor and He is creator of the emperor of the emperors.

lines.gurmukhi: scY qKiq invwsu hY swDsMgiq scKMif vsMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachai Takhati Nivaasu Hai Saadhasangati Sach Khandi Vasandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He sits on the throne of truth and resides in holy congregation, the abode of truth.

lines.gurmukhi: scu Purmwxu nIswxu scu scw hukmu n mUil iPrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Phuramaanu Neesaanu Sachu Sachaa Houkamu N Mooli Dhirandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Truth is His mark and truth He utters and His command is irrefutable.

lines.gurmukhi: scu sbdu tkswl scu gur qy gur huie sbd imlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Sabadu Takasaal Sachu Gur Tay Gur Hui Sabad Miladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He whose Word is true and whose treasure is true, is attainable in the form of the word of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: scI Bgiq BMfwr scu rwg rqn kIrqnu BwvMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachee Bhagati Bhandaar Sachu Raag Ratan Keeratanu Bhaavandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His devotion is true, His warehouse is true and He likes love and praise.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK scw pMQu hY scu dohI scu rwju krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sachaa Pandu Hai Sachu Dohee Sachu Raaju Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of the gurmukhs is also true, their slogan is truth and their kingdom is also the kingdom of truth.

lines.gurmukhi: vIih iekIh cVHwau cVHMdw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Charhhandaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The treader on this path, crossing the world goes on to meet the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Invocation

lines.gurmukhi: gur prmysru jwxIAY scy scw nwau DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Paramaysaru Jaaneeai Sachay Sachaa Naau Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru ought to be known as the Supreme Lord because only that true being has adopted the true name (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwru Awkwru hoie eykMkwr Apwru sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaaru Aakaaru Hoi Aykankaaru Apaaru Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The formless Lord has made His self known in the form of Ekaiikar, the one boundless Being.

lines.gurmukhi: eykMkwrhu sbd Duin EAMkwir Akwru bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aykankaarahu Sabad Dhouni Aoankaari Akaaru Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From Ekanka came up Oankar, the Word vibration which further came to be known as the world, full of names and forms.

lines.gurmukhi: iekdU hoey iqn dyv iqhuN imil ds Avqwr gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ikadoo Hoi Tini Dayv Tihu Mili Das Avataar Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From the one Lord came out three gods (Brahma-, Visnu and Mahes'a) who further got themselves counted among the ten incarnations (of the supreme Being).

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdysu hY Ehu vyKY EnHw ndir n AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Hai Aohu Vaykhai Aonhaa Nadari N Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I salute this primal Being who sees them all but is Himself invisible.

lines.gurmukhi: syK nwgu ismrxu krY nwvwN AMqu ibAMqu n pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saykh Naag Simaranu Karai Naavaa Antu Biantu N Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mythical snake (Sesanag) recites and remembers Him through His myriad names but even then knows nothing about His ultimate extent.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK scu nwau min BwieAw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sachu Naau Mani Bhaaiaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: The true name of same Lord is loved by gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 eISÍrI ausqiq

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of the Wondrous Guru  the Lord

lines.gurmukhi: AMbru Driq ivCoiVAnu kudriq kir krqwr khwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anbaru Dharati Vichhorhianu Kudarati Kari Karataar Kahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: God has stabilized earth and sky separately and for His this power He is known as the creator.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI AMdir pwxIAY ivxu QMmwN Awgwsu rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Andari Paaneeai Vinu Danmaan Aagaasu Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has settled earth in water and without props the sky He has placed in a stable position.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMnHx AMdir Aig Dir Aihins sUrju cMdu aupwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Innhan Andari Agi Dhari Ahinisi Sooraju Chandu Oupaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Putting fire in the fuel He has created sun and moon shining day and night.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruiq bwrhmwh kir KwxI bwxI clqu rcwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Kari Khaanee Baanee Chalatu Rachaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making six seasons and twelve months He has undertaken the sport of creating four mines and four speeches.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs jnmu dulMBu hY sPlu jnmu guru pUrw pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Janamu Dulabhu Hai Saphalu Janamu Guru Pooraa Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Human life is rare and whosoever has found the perfect Gum, his life has become blessed.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil shij smwieAw ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Sahaji Samaaiaa ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting the holy congregation man is absorbed in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Benevolence of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scu dwqwru hY mwxs jnmu Amolu idvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachu Daataaru Hai Maanas Janamu Amolu Divaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is truly benevolent as he has granted us the human life.

lines.gurmukhi: mUhu AKI nku kMnu kir hQ pYr dy clY clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Moohu Akhee Naku Kannu Kari Had Pair Day Chalai Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mouth, eyes, nose, ears He created and has given feet so that the individual could move around.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq aupdysu kir nwmu dwnu iesnwnu idVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Oupadaysu Kari Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Dirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Preaching loving devotion, the true Guru has bestowed on the people steadfastness in remembering the Lord, ablution and charity.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq vylY nwvxw gurmuiK jpu gurmMqu jpwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Vaylai Naavanaa Guramoukhi Japu Guramantu Japaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In ambrosial hours the gurmukhs undertake to inspire themselves and others to bathe and recite the mantra of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: rwq AwrqI soihlw mwieAw ivic audwsu rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raati Aaratee Sohilaa Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the evening, instructing the recitation of Arati and Sohild, the true Guru has inspired people to remain detached even amidst maya.

lines.gurmukhi: imTw bolxu iniv clxu hQhu dyie n Awpu gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Mitdaa Bolanu Nivi Chalanu Hadahu Dayi N Aapu Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru has preached people to speak mildly, to conduct themselves humbly and to not to get noticed even after giving something to others.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir pdwrQ ipCY lwieAw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Padaarad Pichhai Laaiaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way the true Guru has made all the four ideals (dharma, arch, Wm and moks) of life to follow him.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 gur ausqiq

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru vfw AwKIAY vfy dI vfI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Vadaa Aakheeai Vaday Dee Vadee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is called great and the glory of the great is also great.

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwir Akwru kir lK drIAwau n kImiq pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaari Akaaru Kari Lakh Dareeaau N Keemati Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Oankar has assumed the form of the world and millions of life-streams could not know about His grandeur.

lines.gurmukhi: iek vrBMfu AKMfu hY jIA jMq kir irjku idvweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Varabhandu Akhandu Hai Jeea Jant Kari Rijaku Divaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The One Lord uninterruptedly is pervading the whole universe and provides livelihood to all creatures.

lines.gurmukhi: lUMA lUMA ivic riKEnu kir vrBMf kroiV smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Looa Looa Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Varabhand Karorhi Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: That Lord has subsumed crores of universes in His each trichome.

lines.gurmukhi: kyvfu vfw AwKIAY kvx Qwau iksu puCw jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kayvadu Vadaa Aakheeai Kavan Daau Kisu Pouchhaan Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: How His expanse may be explained and whom should one ask as to where He resides.

lines.gurmukhi: ApiV koie n hMGeI suix suix AwKx AwiK suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aparhi Koi N Hanghaee Souni Souni Aakhan Aakhi Sounaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: None can reach Him; all talk about Him is on the basis of hearsay.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru mUriq prgtI AweI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Moorati Paragatee Aaee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: That Lord has become manifest in the form of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 gur ausqiq

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: iDAwnu mUlu gur drsno pUrn bHmu jwix jwxoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiaanu Moolu Gur Darasano Pooran Brahamu Jaani Jaanoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glimpse of the Guru is the basis of meditation because Guru is Brahm and this fact is known to a rare one.

lines.gurmukhi: pUj mUl siqguru crx kir gurdyv syv suK hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Pooj Mool Satiguru Charan Kari Guradayv Sayv Soukh Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The feet of true Guru, the root of all delights, should be worshipped and only then the delight would be atttained.

lines.gurmukhi: mMqR mUlu siqguru bcn iek min hoie ArwDY koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Mantr Moolu Satiguru Bachan Ik Mani Hoi Araadhai Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The instructions of the true Guru is the basic formula (mantra) whose adoration with single minded devotion is undertaken by rare one.

lines.gurmukhi: moK mUlu ikrpwlu guru jIvnu mukiq swDsMig soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Mokh Moolu Kirapaa Guroo Jeevanu Moukati Saadh Sangi Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The basis of liberation is the grace of the Guru and one attains liberation in life in the holy congregation alone.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gxwie n pweIAY Awpu gvwie imlY ivrloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Ganaai N Paaeeai Aapu Gavaai Milai Viraloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making oneself noticed none can attain the Lord and even shedding the ego any rare one meets Him.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwey Awp hY sB ko Awip Awpy sBu koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaaay Aap Hai Sabh Ko Aapi Aapay Sabhu Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who annihilates his ego, in fact, is the Lord Himself; he knowns everyone as his form and all accept him as their form.

lines.gurmukhi: guru cylw cylw guru hoeI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Hoee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way that individual in the form of Guru becomes disciple and the disciple is turned to be Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 cwr jugwN dy Drm

Shabad OS B.translation: Conduct of the four Ages

lines.gurmukhi: siqjuig pwp kmwixAw ieks ipCY sB dysu duKwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Satijoug Paap Kamaaniaa Ikas Pichhai Daysu Doukhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In satyug, the whole country suffered due to the evil deeds of even one individual.

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqY ngrI pIVIAY duAwpuir pwpu vMsu ko dwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Traytai Nagaree Peerheeai Duaapuri Paapu Vansu Ko Daalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In tretayug, the evil committed by one, made the whole city suffer and in dvapar the whole family underwent the pains.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig bIjY so luxY vrqY Drm inAwau suKwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Beejai So Lounai Varatai Dharam Niaau Soukhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Simple is the justice of kaliyug; here only he reaps who sows.

lines.gurmukhi: PlY kmwxw iqhu jugI kiljuig sPlu Drmu qqkwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Phalai Kamaanaa Tihu Jougeen Kalijougi Saphalu Dharamu Tatakaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In other three yugs, the fruit of the action was earned and accumulated but in kaliyug, one gets the fruit of dharma immediately.

lines.gurmukhi: pwp kmwxY lypu hY icqvY Drm suPlu Plvwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Paap Kamaanai Laypu Hai Chitavai Dharam Suphalu Phal Vaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Somethin* happens only after doing something in the kaliyug but even the thought of dharma gives the happy fruit in it.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq gurpurb kir bIjin bIju scI Drmswlw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Gurapurab Kari Beejani Beeju Sachee Dharamasaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs, contemplating on the wisdom of Guru and the loving devotion, sow the seed in earth, the true abode of truth.

lines.gurmukhi: sPl mnorQ pUrx Gwlw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Saphal Manorad Pooran Ghaalaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: They succeed in their practice and objective.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 kiljug dw Drm

Shabad OS B.translation: Conduct in the Kaliyug

lines.gurmukhi: siqjuig siq qRyqY jugw duAwpir pUjw bhlI Gwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Satijougi Sati Traytai Jougaa Duaapari Poojaa Bahalee Ghaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In satyug the truth, in treta and dvapar worship and ascetice discipline were in vogue.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig gurmuiK nwau lY pwir pvY Bvjl Brnwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Guramoukhi Naaoun Lai Paari Pavai Bhavajal Bharanaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs, in kaliyug go across the world-ocean by repeating the name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir crx siqjugY ivic qRyqY cauQY crx aukwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Charan Satijougai Vichi Traytai Chaudai Charan Oukaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dharma had four feet in the satyug but in treta, the fourth foot of dharma was made cripple.

lines.gurmukhi: duAwpuir hoey pYr duie iekqY pYr DrMmu duKwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Duaapuri Hoay Pair Dui Ikatai Pair Dharanmu Doukhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In dvapar only two feet of dharma survived and in kaliyug the dharma stands only on one foot to undergo the sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxu inmwxY jwix kY ibnau krY kir ndir inhwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Maanu Nimaanai Jaani Kai Binau Karai Kari Nadari Nihaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering the Lord as the strength of the powerless ones, it (dharma) started praying for the liberation through the grace of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: guru pUrY prgwsu kir DIrju Drm scI Drmswlw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Poorai Paragaasu Kari Dheeraju Dharam Sachee Dharamasaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord manifesting in the form of the perfect Gum created the true abode of fortitude and the dharma.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Kyq Awpy rKvwlw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Khaytu Aapay Rakhavaalaa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Himself is the field (of creation) and Himself its protector.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 ij`q ky hwrnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Winning by losing

lines.gurmukhi: ijnHwN Bwau iqn nwih Bau mucu Bau AgY inBivAwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Jinhaan Bhaau Tin Naahi Bhau Mouchu Bhau Agai Nibhaviaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are not scared of anybody who have cherished the love of the Lord and those who are devoid of the fear of Lord remain scared in the court of Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Aig qqI jl sIAlw inv clY isru krY auqwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Agi Tatee Jal Seealaa Niv Chalai Siru Karai Outaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Since it keeps its head high, the fire is hot and because the water flows downwards, it is cold.

lines.gurmukhi: Bir fubY KwlI qrY vij n vjY GVY ijvwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhari Doubai Khaalee Tarai Vaji N Vajai Gharhai Jivaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The filled up pitcher drowns and makes no sound and the empty one not only goes on swimming, it rather makes the noise also (likewise is the egotist and the egoless one, the latter absorbing in loving devotion gets liberated and the former goes on tossing

lines.gurmukhi: AMbu suPl Pil Juik lhY duK Plu ArMfu n invY qlwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Anb Suphal Phali Jhouki Lahai Doukh Phalu Arandu N Nivai Talaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being full of fruits, the mango tree bends down in humility but the castor tree being full of bitter fruits never bows in humility.

lines.gurmukhi: mnu pMKyrU Dwvdw sMig suBwie jwie Pl Kwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Manu Pankhayroo Dhaavadaa Sangi Soubhaai Jaai Phal Khaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mind-bird keeps flying and according to its nature picks up the fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: Dir qwrwjU qolIAY haulw Bwrw qolu qulwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhari Taaraajoo Toleeai Haulaa Bhaaraa Tolu Tulaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the scale of justice, the light and the heavy are weighed (and good and bad are differentiated).

lines.gurmukhi: ijix hwrY hwrY ijxY pYrw auqy sIsu Drwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Jini Haarai Haarai Jinai Pairaa Outay Seesu Dharaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who looks to be winning here loses in the court of the Lord and likewise the loser here wins there.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY jg pYrI pwhw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Jag Pairee Paahaa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: All bow at his feet. The individual first falls at the feet (of Guru) and then he makes all to fall at his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 jyhw Bwau qyhw Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: One gets what one desires

lines.gurmukhi: scu hukmu scu lyK hY scu kwrxu kir Kylu rcwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Houkamu Sachu Laykhu Hai Sachu Kaaranu Kari Khaylu Rachaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The order of the Lord is true, His writ is true and from the true cause He has created the creation as His sport.

lines.gurmukhi: kwrxu krqy vis hY ivrlY dw Ehu krY krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaaranu Karatay Vasi Hai Viralai Daa Aohu Karai Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the causes are under the control of the creator but He accepts the deeds of any rare devotee.

lines.gurmukhi: so ikhu horu n mMgeI KsmY dw Bwxw iqsu BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: So Kihu Horu N Mangaee Khasamai Daa Bhaanaa Tisu Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotee who has loved the will of the Lord, does not beg anything from any one else.

lines.gurmukhi: KsmY eyvY Bwvdw Bgiq vClu huie ibrdu sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Khasamai Ayvai Bhaavadaa Bhagati Vachhalu Hui Biradu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the Lord also loves to accept the prayer of the devotee because protection of the devotee is His nature.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu ilv kwrxu krqw krdw AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Liv Kaaranu Karataa Karadaa Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotees who keep their consciousness absorbed in the Word in the holy congregation, know well that the creator Lord is the perennial cause of all causes.

lines.gurmukhi: bwl suBwie AqIq jig vr srwp dw Brmu cukwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baal Soubhaai Ateet Jagi Var Saraap Daa Bharamu Choukaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotee like the innocent child remains detached from the world and keeps himself free from delusions of boons and curses.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw Bwau qyho Plu pwieAw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Bhaau Tayho Phalu Paaiaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: He receives the fruit in accordance with his desert.'

lines.gurmukhi: 11 Aaugx dw gux krxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Making of the virtue from the evil

lines.gurmukhi: Aaugux kIqy gux krY shij suBwau qrovr hMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Aougoun Keetay Goun Karai Sahaji Soubhaau Tarovar Houndaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tree being in equipoise does good even to the evil doer.

lines.gurmukhi: vFx vwlw Cwau bih cMgy dw mMdw icqvMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaddhan Vaalaa Chhaau Bahi Changay Daa Mandaa Chitavandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tree cutter sits under the shade of the same and thinks evil of that benevolent one.

lines.gurmukhi: Pl dy vt vgwieAw vFx vwly qwir qrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Phal Day Vat Vagaaiaan Vaddhan Vaalay Taari Tarandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It gives fruits to the stone throwers and boat to the cutters to get them across.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK Pl nw pwiedy syvk Pl Axgxq PlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Phal Naa Paaiday Sayvak Phal Anaganat Phaladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The individuals opposed to the Gum do not get fruit and the servants receive infinite reward.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK ivrlw jwxIAY syvku syvk syv krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Viralaa Jaaneeai Sayvaku Sayvak Sayvak Sandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare gurmukh is known in this world who serves the servants of the Lord's servants.

lines.gurmukhi: jgu johwry cMd no swier lhir AnMdu vDMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Jagu Johaaray Chand No Saair Lahari Anadu Vadhandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The second day moon is saluted by all and the ocean also becoming glad throws its waves towards it.

lines.gurmukhi: jo qyrw jgu iqs dw bMdw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Tayraa Jagu Tis Daa Bandaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: 0 Lord! the whole world becomes his who is yours own.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 kmwd dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: The example of the sugarcane

lines.gurmukhi: ijau ivsmwdu kmwdu hY isr qlvwieAw hoie aupMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Visamaadu Kamaadu Hai Sir Talavaaiaa Hoi Oupannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having churned the ocean the fourteen jewels were taken out and were distributed (among the gods and demons).

lines.gurmukhi: mix1 lKmI2 pwrjwq3 sMKu4 swrMg5 DxKu ibsnu vis kIqy
lines.transliteration_english: Mani Lakhamee Paarijaat Sankhu Saarang Dhanakhu Bisanu Vasi Keetay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Visnu got hold of gem, Laksami; wish fulfilling tree-parijat, conch, bow named sarang. .

lines.gurmukhi: kwmDyxu1 qy ApCrwN2 AYrwpiq3 ieMdRwsix sIqy
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamadhaynu Tay Apachharaan Airaapati Indraasani Seetay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wish fulfilling cow nymphs, Air5vat elephant were attached to the throne of lndr i.e. they were given him.

lines.gurmukhi: kwlkUt1 qy ArD cMdu2 mhwNdyv msqik Dir pIqy
lines.transliteration_english: Kaalakat Tay Aradh Chand Mahaandayv Masataki Dhari Peetay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mahadev drank the deadly poison and adorned crescent moon on his forehead.

lines.gurmukhi: GoVw1 imilAw sUrjY mdu2 AMimqRu3 dyv dwnv rIqy
lines.transliteration_english: Ghorhaa Miliaa Soorajai Madu Anmritu Dayv Daanav Reetay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sun got the horse and the wine and amrit were emptied by the gods and demons jointly .

lines.gurmukhi: kry DnMqru1 vYdgI fisAw q`Cik miq ibprIqy
lines.transliteration_english: Karay Dhanataru Vaidagee Dasiaa Tachhaki Mati Bipareetay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhanvantrt used to practise medicine but stung by Taksak, the snake, his wisdom got inverted.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdysu Amolkw rqn pdwrQ iniD AgxIqy
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadaysu Amolakaa Ratan Padaarad Nidhi Aganeetay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the ocean of the teachings of the Guru, exist innumerable invaluable jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur isKw scu prIqy ]23]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sikhaan Sachu Pareetay  23

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh's true love is for the Guru alone.

lines.gurmukhi: 24 is`K pRSn

Shabad OS B.translation: The facts about Guru Hargobind

lines.gurmukhi: Drmswl kir bhIdw iekq QwauN n itkY itkwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dharamasaal Kari Baheedaa Ik Daaoun N Tikai Tikaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earlier Gurus considered that to give instructions and to preach to the people, one has to sit at one place known as dharamshala, but this Guru (Hargobind) does riot stick to one place.

lines.gurmukhi: pwiqswh Gir Awvdy giV ciVAw pwiqswh cVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paatisaah Ghari Aavaday Garhi Charhiaa Paatisaah Charhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earlier emperors would visit the house of the Guru, but this Guru has been interned by the king in a fort.

lines.gurmukhi: aumiq mhlu n pwvdI nTw iPrY n frY frwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Oumati Mahalu N Paavadee Natdaa Dhirai N Darai Daraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sarigat coming to have his glimpse cannot find him in the palace (because generally he is not available). Neither he is scared of anybody nor does he scare any one yet he is always on the move.

lines.gurmukhi: mMjI bih sMqoKdw kuqy riK iskwru iKlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Manjee Bahi Santokhadaa Koutay Rakhi Sikaaru Khilaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earlier Gurus sitting on the seat instructed people to be content but this Guru rears dogs and goes out for hunting.

lines.gurmukhi: bwxI kir suix gwNvdw kQY n suxY n gwiv suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baanee Kari Souni Gaanvadaa Kadai N Sounai N Gaavi Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurus used to listen to Gurbani but this Guru neither recites nor (regularly) listens to hymn-singing.

lines.gurmukhi: syvk pws n rKIAin doKI dust AwgU muih lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sayvak Paas N Rakheeani Dokhee Dousat Aagoo Muhi Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He does not keep his follower servants with him and rather maintains nearness with the wicked and the envious ones (Guru had kept Painde Khan nearby).

lines.gurmukhi: scu n lukY lukwieAw crx kvl isK Bvr luBwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu N Loukai Loukaaiaa Charan Kaval Sikh Bhavar Loubhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the truth is never concealed and that is why on the lotus feet of the Guru, the mind of 'Sikhs hover like a greedy black-bee.

lines.gurmukhi: Ajru jrY n Awpu jxwieAw ]24]
lines.transliteration_english: Ajaru Jarai N Aapu Janaaiaa  24

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Hargobding has borne the unbearable and he has not made himself manifest.

lines.gurmukhi: 25 iprm sr duSqr QwN hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Joy of love is attained after great hardship

lines.gurmukhi: KyqI vwiV su iFMgrI ikkr Aws pws ijau bwgY
lines.transliteration_english: Khaytee Vaarhi Su Ddhingaree Kikar Aas Paas Jiu Baagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Around the agricultural field the bushes are kept as fence and around the garden acacia. trees (for its safety) are planted.

lines.gurmukhi: sp plyty cMnxY bUhy jMdRw kuqw jwgY
lines.transliteration_english: Sap Palaytay Channanai Boohay Jandaa Koutaa Jaagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sandalwood tree is entwined by snakes and for the safety of treasure the lock is used and the dog also remains awake.

lines.gurmukhi: kvlY kMfy jwxIAin isAwxw ieku koeI ivic PwgY ]
lines.transliteration_english: Kavalai Kanday Jaaneeani Siaanaa Iku Koee Vichi Dhaagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thorns are known to live near flowers and during the ho/frevelty among the turbulent crowd one or two wise men also remain persent.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau pwrsu ivic pQrw mix msqik ijau kwlY nwgY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Paarasu Vichi Padaraan Mani Masataki Jiu Kaalai Naagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the jewel remains in the head of black cobra the philosopher's stone remains surrounded by stones.

lines.gurmukhi: rqnu sohY gil poq ivic mYglu bDw kcY DwgY
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanu Sohai Gali Pot Vichi Maigalu Badhaa Kachai Dhaagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the garland of jewels on both the side of a jewel glass is kept to protect it and the elephant remains tied with the thread cf love.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwv Bgiq BuK jwie Gir ibdru KvwlY ipMnI swgY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaav Bhagati Bhoukh Jaai Ghari Bidaru Khavaalai Pinnee Saagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lord Krsna for his love for the devotees goes to Vidur's home when hungry and the latter offers him beans of sag, a green leafy vegetable.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl guru isK Baur swDsMgiq shlMgu sBwgY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Guru Sikh Bhaur Saadhasangati Sahalagu Sabhaagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru becoming black bee of the lotus feet of the Guru, ought to attain good fortune in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwly duqru JwgY ]25]
lines.transliteration_english: Param Piaalay Doutaru Jhaagai  25

Shabad OS B.translation: He should further know that cup of the love of the Lord is got after very hard

lines.gurmukhi: 26 murId murdw gurU gor

Shabad OS B.translation: The dead disciple in the Guru-grave

lines.gurmukhi: Bvjl AMdir mwnsru sq smuMdI gihr gMBIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhavajal Andari Maanasaru Sat Samoundee Gahir Ganbheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deeper than the seven seas of the world is the mental world ocean known as Manasarovar

lines.gurmukhi: nw pqxu n pwqxI pwrwvwru n AMqu n cIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Patanu Naa Paatanee Paaraavaaru N Antu N Cheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Which has no wharf no boatman and no end or bound.

lines.gurmukhi: nw byVI n qulhVw vMJI hwiQ n DIrk DIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Bayrhee Naa Tulaharhaa Vanjhee Haadi N Dheerak Dheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: To go across it there is neither vessel nor raft; neither barge pole no any one to console.

lines.gurmukhi: horu n koeI ApVY hMs cugMdy moqI hIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Horu N Koee Aparhai Hans Chouganday Motee Heeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: None else can reach there except the swans who pick up pearls from there.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur swNig vrqdw ipMfu vswieAw Pyir AhIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Saangi Varatadaa Pindu Vasaaiaa Dhayri Aheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru enacts his play and populates desolate places.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdu Amwvs rwiq ijau AlKu n lKIAY mCulI nIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Chandu Amaavas Raati Jiu Alakhu N Lakheeai Machhulee Neeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sometimes He hides himself like moon in amavas (no moon night) or fish in water.

lines.gurmukhi: muey murId goir gur pIrw ]26]
lines.transliteration_english: Muay Mureed Gori Gur Peeraa  26

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who have become dead to their ego, they only absorb in the eternal trance in the from of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 27 gur is`KwN dI vMs

Shabad OS B.translation: Progeny of the Sikhs of Guru

lines.gurmukhi: mCI dy prvwr vwNig jIvix mrix n ivsrY pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Machhee Day Paravaar Vaangi Jeevani Marani N Visarai Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gursikh is like the family of fish who whether dead or alive never forgets water.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau prvwru pqMg dw dIpk bwJu n hor sujwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Paravaaru Patang Daa Deepak Baajhu N Hor Su Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly to the moth family nothing but the flame of lamp is visible.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jl kvlu ipAwru hY Bvr kvl kul pRIiq vKwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jal Kavalu Piaaru Hai Bhavar Kaval Kul Preeti Vakhaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the water and the lotus love each other and the tales are told of the love between the black bee and the lotus;

lines.gurmukhi: bUMd bbIhy imrg nwd koiel ijau Pl AMib luBwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Boond Babeehay Mirag Naad Koil Jiu Phal Anbi Loubhaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the rain bird with the rain-drop of svati nakstr, deer with music and the nightingale with mango fruit is attached;

lines.gurmukhi: mwn srovru hMsulw Ehu Amolk rqnw KwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Sarovaru Hansulaa Aohu Amolak Ratanaa Khaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: For swans the Manasarovar is the mine of jewels;

lines.gurmukhi: ckvI sUrj hyqu hY cMd ckorY coj ivfwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Chakavee Sooraj Haytu Hai Chand Chakorai Choj Vidaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Female reddy sheldrake loves sun; Indian red legged partidge' s love with moon is praised;

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK vMsI prm hMs siqgur shij srovru jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Vansee Param Hans Satigur Sahaji Sarovaru Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like wise, the Sikh of the Guru being the progeny of the swan of high order (paramhans) accepts the true Guru as the tank of equipoise

lines.gurmukhi: murgweI nIswxu nYswxI ]27]
lines.transliteration_english: Muragaaee Neesaanu Neesaanee  27

Shabad OS B.translation: And like a waterfowl goes to face the world ocean ( and goes across unwet).

lines.gurmukhi: 28 gur isKwN dI vMs

Shabad OS B.translation: Progeny of the Sikhs of Guru

lines.gurmukhi: kCU AMfw syNvdw jl bwhir Dir iDAwnu DrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Kachhoo Andaa Saynvadaa Jal Baahari Dhari Dhiaanu Dharandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tortoise hatches its eggs out side water and keeping track of those rears them up.

lines.gurmukhi: kUMj kryNdI ismrxo pUrx bcw hoie aufMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Koonj Karayndee Simarano Pooran Bachaa Hoi Udandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By virtue of the mother's remembrance the young one of the heron bird starts flying in the sky.

lines.gurmukhi: kukVI bcw pwldI murgweI no jwie imlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Koukarhee Bachaa Paaladee Muragaaee No Jaai Miladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The kid of waterfowl is reared up by hen but ultimately it goes to meet its mother ( waterfowl).

lines.gurmukhi: koiel pwlY kwvxI lohU lohU rlY rlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Koil Paalai Kaavanee Lohoo Lohoo Ralai Raladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The offsprings of nightingale are nurtured by female crow but finally the blood goes to meet the blood.

lines.gurmukhi: ckvI Aqy ckor kul isv skqI imil mylu krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Chakavee Atay Chakor Kul Siv Sakatee Mili Maylu Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moving around in the illusions of Siva and Sakti (maya) the female ruddy sheldrake and Indian red legged partridge also ultimately meet their beloved ones.

lines.gurmukhi: cMd sUrj sy jwxIAin iCA ruiq bwrh mwh idsMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Chand Sooraju Say Jaaneeani Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Disandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the stars, the sun and the moon are perceptible throughout the six seasons and the twelve months.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mylw sc dw kvIAwN kvl Bvru ivgsMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maylaa Sach Daa Kaveeaan Kaval Bhavaru Vigasandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the black bee is happy among lilies and lotuses,

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl AlKu lKMdw ]28]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhandaa  28

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs get delighted to perceive the truth and attain the fruit of pleasures.

lines.gurmukhi: 29 dwvw kokw

Shabad OS B.translation: The claim of Koka, the male nurse

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs vMsI hoie kY sBnw DwqU myil imlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasavansee Hoi Kai Sabhanaa Dhaatoo Mayli Miladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being of a noble family, the philosopher's stone meets all the metals (and makes them gold).

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu suBwau hY APl sPl ivic vwsu DrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu Soubhaau Hai Aphal Saphal Vichi Vaasu Dharandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The nature of the sandal is fragrant and it makes all fruitless as well as fruitful trees fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: lK qrMgI gMg hoie ndIAw nwly gMg hovMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Tarangee Gang Hoi Nadeeaa Naalay Gang Hovandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Ganges is formeds of many tributaries but meeting the Ganges they all become Ganges.

lines.gurmukhi: dwvw duDu pIAwilAw pwiqswhw kokw BwvMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Daavaa Dudhu Peeaaliaa Paatisaahaa Kokaa Bhaavandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Koka's claim of having served as the milk giver to the king is liked by the king

lines.gurmukhi: lUx Kwie pwiqswh dw kokw cwkru hoie vlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Loon Khaai Paatisaah Daa Kokaa Chaakar Hoi Valadaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And Koka also having eaten the salt of the royal household hovers around the king to serve him.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur vMsI prmhMsu guru isK hMs vMsu inbhMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Vansee Param Hansu Guru Sikh Hans Vansu Nibahandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is of the lineage of the swans of high order and the Sikhs of the Guru also abide by the tradition of the swan family.

lines.gurmukhi: ipau dwdy dy rwih clMdw ]29]
lines.transliteration_english: Pia Daaday Day Raahi Chaladaa  29

Shabad OS B.translation: Both follow the path shown by their forefathers.

lines.gurmukhi: 30 gurU nwnk dyv

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs pass the test given by the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: ijau lK qwry cmkdy nyiV n idsY rwiq Anyry
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Lakh Taaray Chamakaday Nayrhi N Disai Raati Anayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite millions of stars shine in the sky in the darkness of night yet things are not visible even if they are kept near by.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrju bdl CwieAw rwiq n pujY idhsY Pyry
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraju Badal Chhaaiaa Raati N Pujai Dihasai Dhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the other hand even coming of the sun under the clouds, their shadow cann't change day into night.

lines.gurmukhi: jy guru swNig vrqdw duibDw iciq n isKwN kyry
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Gur Saangi Varatadaa Doubidhaa Chiti N Sikhaan Kayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even if the Guru enacts any sham, the doubts are not created in the mind of the Sikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruqI ieku suJu hY GuGU suJ n suJY hyry
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routee Iku Sujhu Hai Ghoughoo Sujh N Sujhai Hayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all the six seasons, the same sun remains in the sky but the owl cannot see it .

lines.gurmukhi: cMdrmuKI sUrjmuKI kvlY Bvr imlin cauPyry
lines.transliteration_english: Chandaramoukhee Soorajamoukhee Kavalai Bhavar Milani Chaudhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: But lotus blossoms in the sunlight as well as in the moonlit night and the black bee starts hovering around it (because they love lotus and not the sun or the, moon ).

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI no lMiG kY swDsMgiq jwie imlin svyry
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee No Laghi Kai Saadhasangati Jaai Milani Savayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite the illusive phenomena created by maya (i.e. Siva and Sakti) the Sikhs of the Guru, come to join the holy congregation in the ambrosial hours.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pvxw Bly Blyry ]30]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pavanaa Bhalay Bhalayray  30

Shabad OS B.translation: Reaching there they touch the feet of one and all good and the better one.

lines.gurmukhi: 31 duinAwvI pwqSwh

Shabad OS B.translation: The difference between the spiritual and the temporal kings

lines.gurmukhi: dunIAwvw pwiqswhu hoie dyie mrY puqY pwiqswhI
lines.transliteration_english: Douneeaavaa Paatisaahu Hoi Dayi Marai Poutai Paatisaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The temporal king dies after handing over the kingdom to his son .

lines.gurmukhi: dohI PyrY AwpxI hukmI bMdy sB ispwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Dohee Dhayrai Aapanee Houkamee Banday Sabh Sipaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He establishes his sway over the world and all his soldiers obey him.

lines.gurmukhi: kuqbw jwie pVwiedw kwjI mulwN krY augwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Koutabaa Jaai Parhaaidaa Kaajee Mulaan Karai Ougaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the mosque he orders prayers to be said in his name and gaffs and the mullahs (spritual persons in the religious orders of Islam) testify for him.

lines.gurmukhi: tkswlY iskw pvY hukmY ivic supydI isAwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Takasaalai Sikaa Pavai Houkamai Vichi Soupaydee Siaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From the mint comes out the coin in his name and every right and wrong is committed at his order.

lines.gurmukhi: mwlu mulku Apxwiedw qKq bKq cViH byprvwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Maalu Mulaku Apanaaidaa Takhat Bakhat Charhhi Bayparavaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He controlles the property and wealth of the country and sits on the throne caring for none. (However) The tradition of the House of the Guru is that the high way shown by earlier Gurus is followed .

lines.gurmukhi: bwbwxY Gir cwl hY gurmuiK gwfI rwhu inbwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaanai Ghari Chaal Hai Guramoukhi Gaadee Raahu Nibaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this tradition only the one primal Lord is applauded; the mint (holy congregation) is one here;

lines.gurmukhi: iek dohI tkswl iek kuqbw qKqu scw drgwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Dohee Takasaal Ik Koutabaa Takhatu Sachaa Daragaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sermon (of Min) is one and the true throne (the spiritual seat) is also one here.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu dwid ielwhI ]31]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Daadi Ilaahee ?31?

Shabad OS B.translation: Justice of the Lord is such that this fruit of pleasure is given to the gurmukhs by the supreme Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 32 gurU qoN AwkI

Shabad OS B.translation: Miserable plight of the apostate

lines.gurmukhi: jyko Awpu gxwie kY pwiqswhwN qy AwkI hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Ko Aapu Ganaai Kai Paatisaahaan Tay Aakee Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If soemeone in his pride stands opposed to the king, he is killed

lines.gurmukhi: huie kqlwmu hrwmuKor kwxu n KPxu icqw n tovY
lines.transliteration_english: Hui Katalaamu Haramaakhoru Kaatdu N Khadhanu Chitaa N Tovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And considering him a bastard pyre, coffin or grave are not available to him.

lines.gurmukhi: tkswlhu bwhir GVY KotYhwrw jnmu ivgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Takasaalahu Baahari Gharhai Khotaihaaraa Janamu Vigovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out side the mint one who is coining fake coins is losing his life in vain , (because when caught he will be punished ).

lines.gurmukhi: ilbwsI Purmwxu iliK hoie nukswnI AMJU rovY
lines.transliteration_english: Libaasee Phuramaanu Likhi Hoi Noukasaanee Anjhoo Rovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Giver of the false commands also weeps tearfully when caught.

lines.gurmukhi: igdV dI kir swihbI boil kubolu n Aibclu hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Gidarh Dee Kari Saahibee Boli Koubolu N Abichalu Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A jackal pretending to be a lion may ,pose to be a commander but cannot hide his true howl (and is caught).

lines.gurmukhi: muih kwlY gdih cVHY rwau pVy vI BirAw DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Muhi Kaalai Gadahi Charhhai Raau Parhay Vee Bhariaa Dhovay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the tier when caught is made to mount the ass and dust is thrown on his head . He washes himself in his tears.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjY Bwie kuQwie KlovY ]32]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojai Bhaai Kudaai Khalovai ?32?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way, the man absorbed in the duality reaches the wrong place.

lines.gurmukhi: 33 gurU bMswvlI dI hauN

Shabad OS B.translation: The ego of the Guru's progeny

lines.gurmukhi: bwl jqI hY isrIcMdu bwbwxw dyhurw bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baal Jatee Hai Sireechandu Baabaanaa Dayhuraa Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sirichand ( the elder son of Guru Nanak) is celebate since childhood who has constructed the monument ( in memory) of Guru Nanak.

lines.gurmukhi: lKmI dwshu Drm cMd poqw huie kY Awpu gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakhameedaasahu Dharamachand Potaa Hui Kai Aapu Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dharam chand son of Laksami Das ( second son of Guru Nanak) also made display of his egotism.

lines.gurmukhi: mMjI dwsu bhwilAw dwqw isDwsx isiK AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Manjee Daasu Bahaaliaa Daataa Sidhaasan Sikhi Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Angad's one son Dasu was made to sit on the seat of Guruship and the second son Data also learnt to sit in the siddh posture i.e. both the sons of Guru Angad Dev were pretender Guru and during the time of third Guru Amar Das they tried their best to

lines.transliteration_english: Mohanu Kamalaa Hoiaa Chaoubaaraa Moharee Manaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mohan (son of Guru Amar Das) got afflicted and Mohart (the second son) lived in a lofty house and started getting served by the people.

lines.gurmukhi: mIxw hoAw iprQIAw kir kir tyFk brlu clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Meenaa Hoaa Piradeeaa Kari Kari Tonddhak Baralu Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Prithichind (son of Guru Ram Das) came out as dissembling scoundrel and using his oblique nature spread his mental sickness all round.

lines.gurmukhi: mhwdyau AhMmyau kir kir bymuKu kuqw BaukwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaadayu Ahanmayu Kari Kari Baymoukhu Poutaan Bhaoukaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mahidev (another son of Guru Ram Das) was egotist who was also led astray.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu n vws bohwieAw ]33]
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu N Vaas Bohaaiaa ?33?

Shabad OS B.translation: They all were like bamboos who though lived near sandal – Guru, yet could not become fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: 34 guirAweI dI pIVHI

Shabad OS B.translation: Lineage of the Guruship

lines.gurmukhi: bwbwxI pIVI clI gur cyly prcw prcwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaanee Peerhee Chalee Gur Chaylay Parachaa Parachaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The line of Baia Nanak increased and the love between Guru and disciples further developed.

lines.gurmukhi: guru AMgdu guru AMgu qy guru cylw cylw guru BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Angadu Guru Angu Tay Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Angad came of the limb of Guru Nanak and the disciple became fond of Guru and the Guru of the disciple .

lines.gurmukhi: Amrdwsu gur AMgdhu siqgur qy siqgurU sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Amaradaasu Gur Angadahu Satiguru Tay Satiguroo Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From Guru Ahgad came out Amar Das who was accepted Guru after Guru Angad Dev.

lines.gurmukhi: guru Amrhu guru rwmdwsu gur syvw guru hoie smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Amarahu Guru Raamadaasu Gur Sayvaa Guru Hoi Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From Guru Amar Das came Guru Ram Das who through his service to the Guru absorbed in the Guru himself.

lines.gurmukhi: rwmdwshu Arjxu gurU AMmiRq biRiK AMmiRq Plu lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raamadaasahu Arajanu Guroo Anmrit Brikhi Anmrit Phalu Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From Guru Ram Das emerged Guru Arjan Dev as if from the ambrosial tree was produced ambrosia.

lines.gurmukhi: hrgoivMd guru ArjnhuN Awid purK Awdysu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Harigovindu Guru Arajanahu Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then from Guru Arjan Dev was born Guru Hargobind who also preached and spread the message of the primal Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: suJY suJ n lukY lukwieAw ]34]
lines.transliteration_english: Sujhai Sujh N Loukai Loukaaiaa ?34?

Shabad OS B.translation: The sun is ever perceptible; it cannot be concealed by any one.

lines.gurmukhi: 35 kudrq vrxn

Shabad OS B.translation: Description of the power of the Lord

lines.gurmukhi: ieku kvwau pswau kir EAMkwir kIAw pwswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Keeaa Paasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From one sound, the Oankar created the entire creation.

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq Aqul n qolIAY quil n qol n qolxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Atul N Toleeai Tuli N Tol N Tolanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His sport of creation is immeasurable. None is there who can take its measure.

lines.gurmukhi: isir isir lyKu AlyK dw dwiq joiq vifAweI kwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Siri Siri Laykhu Alaykh Daa Daati Joti Vadiaaee Kaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The writ has been inscribed on the forehead of each creature; light, grandeur and action are all due to His grace.

lines.gurmukhi: lyK AlyKu n lKIAY msu n lyKix ilKixhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Laykhu Alakhu N Lakheeai Masu N Laykhani Likhanihaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His writ is imperceptible; the writer and His inl are also invisible.

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd Anhd DunI EAMkwru n gwvxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Anahadu Dhounee Aoankaaru N Gaavanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Various musics, tones and rythms ate ever on but even rthen the Onkaar cannot be properly serenaded.

lines.gurmukhi: KwxI bwxI jIA jMqu nwv Qwau Axgxq Awpwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaanee Baanee Jeea Jantu Naav Daav Anaganat Apaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mines, speeches, creatures names and places are infinite and uncountable.

lines.gurmukhi: ieku kvwau Amwau hY kyvfu vfw isrjxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Kavaau Amaau Hai Kayvadu Vadaa Sirajanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His one sound is beyond all limits; how expansive that creator is cannot be explained .

lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Satigur Nirankaaraa ?35?26? Chhaveeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: That true Guru , formless Lord is there and available in the holy congregation (alone)

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir bYr inrbYr Bey pUrn bHm gur srb mY jwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Bair Nirabair Bhaay , Pooran Braham Gur Sarab Mai Jaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who abide by Guru's teachings with faith and sincerity are without rancour. They carry no enmity for anyone because they have realised His presence in everybody.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir Byd inrByd Bey duibDw ibiD inKyD Kyd ibnwsny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Bhayd Nirabhayd Bhaay , Doubidhaa Bidhi Nikhaydh Khayd Binaasanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who practice the teachings of the Guru are free from discriminatory temperament. All are alike for them. The sense of dualism and attitude of condemnation of others disappear from their mind.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir bwies prmhMs igAwn AMs bMs inrgMD gMD Twny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Baais Paramahansa , Giaan Ans Bans Niragandh Gandh Tthaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those crow-like dross-filled persons who adopt Guru's wisdom as truth are able to shed all the dross and become clean and pious. A miniscule of spiritual knowledge help them spread the fragrance of the Lord like Sandalwood.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir krm Brm Koey Awsw mY inrws huie ibsÍws aur Awny hY ]26]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Karam Bharam Khoay , Aasaa Mai Niraas Hui Bisvaas Ur Aanay Hai ?26?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who abide by the teachings of the Guru destroy all their doubts of rites and rituals. They become unattached with worldly desires and imbibe the intellect of the Guru in their hearts. (26)
